attributes.overallObjectives: Students will develop a comprehensive understanding of fundamental financial concepts, analytical skills, and practical applications in modern finance. Through hands-on exercises, case studies, and real-world examples, students will master essential financial principles while developing critical thinking and analytical capabilities. The course combines theoretical frameworks with practical problem-solving using industry-standard tools and methods.
classObjectives: Week 1 | Time Value of Money: Learn to calculate present and future values, understand annuity calculations and timing in financial decisions
Week 2 | Perpetuity and Financial Modeling: Apply concepts to real estate and bond valuations, explore infinite cash flow streams
Week 3 | Interest Calculations: Master simple and compound interest, analyze rate structures and effective vs. nominal rates
Week 4 | Bond Analysis: Study bond pricing, yield calculations, duration and convexity concepts
Week 5 | Stock Valuation: Explore valuation methods, dividend discount models, and fundamental analysis techniques
Week 6 | Risk Management: Study portfolio theory, diversification principles, and risk-return relationships
Week 7 | Capital Budgeting: Learn NPV, IRR calculations, and investment decision frameworks
Week 8 | Financial Analysis: Master statement analysis, key metrics, and company valuation methods
